bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Thomas Craig was a tailor who also owned a tavern in the Market Square section of Williamsburg from ca. 1760-1770.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Indenture (deed) between the feoffees and directors for the City of Williamsburg and Thomas Craig, tailor, for land on Market Square, July 9, 1771; signed by John Blair, Peyton Randolph, William Pierce, Severinus Durfey, James Minzies, Benjamin Harrison, William Rose, and James Douglas.
